greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest prime either of the form n*2^k - 1 or n*2^k + 1, k >= 0, or 0 if no such prime exists.
comment: Primes arising from A194591 (or 0 if no such prime exists).
Many of these terms are in A093868.
link: Arkadiusz Wesolowski, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
example: For n=7, 7*2^0-1 and 7*2^0+1 are composite, but 7*2^1-1=13 is prime, so a(7)=13.
mathematica: Table[k = 0; While[! PrimeQ[a = n*2^k - 1] && ! PrimeQ[a = n*2^k + 1], k++]; a, {n, 100}] (* _Arkadiusz Wesolowski_, Sep 04 2011 *)

n2k[n_]:=Module[{k=0},While[NoneTrue[n*2^k+{1,-1},PrimeQ],k++];SelectFirst[ n*2^k+{-1,1},PrimeQ]]; Array[n2k,70] (* The program uses the NoneTrue and SelectFirst functions from Mathematica version 10 *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Jun 03 2015 *)
results.author: _Arkadiusz Wesolowski_, Aug 30 2011
